org.araneaframework.http
Interface StateVersioningContext.ClientNavigationAware

Enclosing interface:
StateVersioningContext
public static interface StateVersioningContext.ClientNavigationAware

Interface that should be implemented by Components who wish to be notified of various events in state versioning context. These callbacks are guaranteed to be called after the current state has been established. Therefore all implementors can be components.

Since:
1.2 (introduced), 2.0 (refactored)
Author:
Taimo Peelo (taimo@araneaframework.org), Martti Tamm (martti@araneaframework.org)

Method Summary
 void afterStatesChange(List<String> stateIds)
          This is called when changes are made to the stored states.
 void onCurrentStateUpdate(String currentStateId)
          This is called when the incoming request sends an AJAX-based action for a component to do something.

          This is called when the incoming request is for retrieving an existing state.
 void onUsualNavigation(String baseStateId, String newStateId)
          This is called when the incoming request sends an event for a component to do something.
 

Method Detail

onUsualNavigation

void onUsualNavigation(String baseStateId,
                       String newStateId)
This is called when the incoming request sends an event for a component to do something. The result is not determined and the post-request state will be added to existing states.

Parameters:
baseStateId - The ID of the state that the request depends on. It is null on first request when no versioned state exists yet.
newStateId - The ID that will be assigned to the created state.

onCurrentStateUpdate

void onCurrentStateUpdate(String currentStateId)
This is called when the incoming request sends an AJAX-based action for a component to do something. The hierarchy of the base state is not expected to change, maybe the state of some widgets changes. All states that are altered by action requests are just updated, no new state will be added.

Parameters:
currentStateId - The ID of the state the request depends on. The state will be updated with the current state.

onHistoryNavigation

void onHistoryNavigation(String sourceStateId,
                         String targetStateId)
This is called when the incoming request is for retrieving an existing state. No changes will be done to stored states

Parameters:
sourceStateId - The ID of the state from which navigation is started.
targetStateId - The ID of the state where navigation should end.

afterStatesChange

void afterStatesChange(List<String> stateIds)
This is called when changes are made to the stored states. The changes include expiring or deleting because of they are not accessible any more. The latter is case like when the user moves in the application from state A through state B to state C, then moves back to state B, and starts a new state D, after which state C will be discarded. The changes do not include updating a state as in onCurrentStateUpdate(String).

Parameters:
stateIds - The unmodifiable list of current valid states.
